description: Gets information about a rescore execution plan. A rescore execution plan is an Amazon Kendra Intelligent Ranking resource used for provisioning the Rescore API.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identifier of the rescore execution plan that you want to get information on.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the rescore execution plan.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rescore execution plan.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name for the rescore execution plan.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for the rescore execution plan.

nested_items.name: CapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The capacity units set for the rescore execution plan. A capacity of zero indicates that the rescore execution plan is using the default capacity. For more information on the default capacity and additional capacity units, see Adjusting capacity.

nested_items.name: RescoreCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The amount of extra capacity for your rescore execution plan.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp of when the rescore execution plan was created.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp of when the rescore execution plan was last updated.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the rescore execution plan. When the value is ACTIVE, the rescore execution plan is ready for use. If the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains a message that explains why.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: When the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains a message that explains why.
